alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN CHEROKEE AND SOUTHERN CRAWFORD COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM CDT... At 644 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mccune, or 8 miles east of Parsons, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsburg, Frontenac, Cherokee, Weir, Sherman, Scammon, Chicopee, Mccune, Asbury, West Mineral, Roseland, Beulah, Opolis, Yale, Lawton, Carona, Lone Oak, Skidmore and Stippville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Kansas...and southwestern Missouri.
